Guys! 'tis now our mission to make wikipedia accept this: "\* 2015 – Kerbal Space Program v1.0 released. Major hype involving 302 injuries and 1 death. involved an estimated 2,000,000 people."

All you gotta do is copy & paste this while editing the article and then save it: \* 2015 – Kerbal Space Program v1.0 released. Major hype involving 302 injuries and 1 death. involved an estimated 2,000,000 people. on the events area of the page.

Link is: [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=April_27&oldid=657976304&diff=cur&diffonly=0](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=April_27&oldid=657976304&diff=cur&diffonly=0)

- - - Updated - - -

Bad news: if you try it more than 4 times they will ban you from editing anything anymore. which i dont have a problem with, but do it at your own discretion, i did not force this upon you.

Wikipedia vandalists: just wait a few days or a week until they stop monitoring the page so much and try to sneak it in. If you keep trying to change the same page on the same day, the article will be upped a 'security color' and watched more closely. If you really care, then just wait, or buy off somebody with power in the Wikipedia network.

HYPE.

The FIRST video in the three-part series, Korbital Mechanics 101 is in the toaster! It will be ready for release on Monday along with Kerbal Space Program. Here's an excerpt from the intro:

"Orbits in Kerbal Space Program follow the same laws as orbits around the Earth and Sun. This video examines the First Law of Planetary Motion and how it can be used to understand what it takes to reach an orbit around Kerbin, home planet to the Kerbals."

It's only 8 minutes long - but packed with good stuff. (It took me forever to put it together) Now, on to Part Two!
